oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Production yield of rare-earth ions implanted into an optical crystal
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kornher, Thomas
Xia, Kangwei
Kolesov, Roman
Kukharchyk, Nadezhda
Reuter, Rolf
Siyushev, Petr
Stöhr, Rainer
Schreck, Matthias
Becker, Hans-Werner
Villa, Bruno
Wieck, Andreas D.
Wrachtrup, Jörg
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rare-earth ions doped into desired locations of optical crystals might enable a range of novel integrated photonic devices for quantum applications. With this aim, we have investigated the production yield of cerium and praseodymium by means of ion implantation. As a measure, the collected fluorescence intensity from both, implanted samples and single centers was used. With a tailored annealing procedure for cerium, a yield up to 53% was estimated. Praseodymium yield amounts up to 91%.
